text:
The UX on here can be a little cumbersome to navigate at times, but it's beautiful otherwise. Always on end-to-end encryption ensures all messages remain secure, which is a MUST.

While I appreciate that Wire uses Free (as in freedom) and Open Source software to handle the encryption, I don't believe the entire app is open source, which leaves the potential for a hidden flaw or backdoor. Until the app is fully open sourced, I continue to recommend Signal from Openwhispersystems instead.
title: Gorgeous app that takes bold steps to protect privacy

text: Wire has made a lot of improvement since I first started using it
title: Great new update

text: After weeks of waiting for better design, with this last update I'm finally deleting the app and taking all my friends with me until you start feeding your designer again. The performance of the messenger is far worse than others, but the only thing that kept me using it was its design and sounds. Now when it's grotesque and egocentric, nothing else holds me.
